summary: Brian Latell is identified as the Director of the Center for the Study of Intelligence in 1995. His involvement in the JFK assassination context stems from advising against appealing the JFK Review Board's decision to release the names of two CIA employees who retired under cover. He argued that the DO's (Directorate of Operations) damage argument wouldn't merit Presidential reversal. The documents suggest his role was primarily related to the declassification and review of JFK assassination records within the CIA.
key_connections: Center for the Study of Intelligence
significance: Brian Latell's significance lies in his role as Director of the Center for the Study of Intelligence during the period when the CIA was actively involved in declassifying and reviewing JFK assassination records. His advice against appealing the release of CIA employees' names indicates his involvement in the decision-making process regarding transparency and potential damage to ongoing operations.
